Technique: ROUGH-HEWN; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Hieratic Ostracon
Description: This large limestone ostracon was acquired at Dra Abu el-Naga in 1901 by J. Capart. The hieratic texts written on the two sides are very damaged. They contain a journal relating to a work strike in the Theban necropolis. The piece dates from the New Kingdom.
